metadata.titel_preek: Smyrna: The Rich Poor Church, Part 2

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The struggle of the faithful believer to endure suffering and persecution in order to receive the crown of life from the eternal Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: they would not acknowledge Caesar as Lord

object.identificatie: The Crown of Life / Salvation from the Second Death
tekstueel_bewijs: I will give thee a crown of life
shall not be hurt of the second death

zender.identificatie: Jesus Christ (The First and the Last)
tekstueel_bewijs: This is his command. These are our marching orders.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Faithful / The Church at Smyrna
tekstueel_bewijs: to these people, 'I know your tribulation'
God deliver every one of you
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (the one who must hold on).

helper.identificatie: God's knowledge/empathy and the Name of Jesus
tekstueel_bewijs: your heavenly Father knows your capacity
What a power there is in the name of Jesus!
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily a Helper/Observer who knows limits, rather than the Subject who acts.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Empire, The Devil, and Suffering
tekstueel_bewijs: The devil shall cast some of you into prison
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just social persecution but the 'Second Death' and the Devil, creating a high-stakes conflict.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The historical faithfulness of Polycarp and the Smyrnaean martyrs as a model for the current audience.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Polycarp / Early Christians
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The historical program serves as the 'Savoir-faire' (knowledge/example) for the hearer's current 'Devoir-faire' (obligation).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Christ (The First/Last) → Crown of Life → The Faithful
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: God's Knowledge → The Hearer ← The Devil/Second Death
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Hearer → Holding On → Crown of Life

voorbeelden_god_subject: God knows the limits of our ability
I will give thee a crown of life
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you wonder how you're going to make it

voorbeelden: we want to feel that the people... will be in business
I know some clues why we suffer
God knows the limits of our ability

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily weighted toward obligation (Devoir). The hearer is told what they must do (be faithful, hold on) with the assurance that God knows their limit, but the 'Pouvoir' (power) is largely left to the human will to 'hold on'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the reality of S1 (Smyrna's faith) to the threat of S2 (Second Death), then back to S1 via the command to 'Hold on'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through human endurance (Subject) backed by the reliability of the Sender (Christ as an 'established firm').
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high. The 'Second Death' is described as an 'endless nightmare' and 'awful separation'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high Christological language (The First and the Last), the underlying actantial engine is synergistic/moralistic. The hearer is the Subject who must 'hold on' to achieve the Object. God is the Sender and Helper, but not the primary Actor in the present struggle.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I will give thee, if thou art faithful, a crown of life.
Hold on. Stand the storm. It won't be long.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Statius Quadratus being Proconsul, but Jesus Christ King forever.
your heavenly Father knows your capacity

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Polycarp and the early Christians are used as the standard of faithfulness that the hearer must replicate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how Christ was faithful unto death *for* the church of Smyrna when they could not be.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Increases pressure to perform; spiritual exhaustion ('how you're going to make it through another day').
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is contingent upon the Subject's ability to 'hold on' until the end.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically powerful but narratively tense because it places the burden of the 'cosmic' battle on the 'shivering' human subject.
spanning_punten: The contrast between the 'chilled spirits' of humans and the 'marching orders' they are given.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ King forever... I am the First and the Last.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is invoked to 'deliver' but not described as the internal source of the 'Pouvoir-faire'.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (must be faithful) to receive from God.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Recruitment' narrative. It awakens the 'Vouloir' (will) and 'Devoir' (duty) but leaves the 'Pouvoir' (power) to the hearer's own endurance.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the Subject of 'holding on' and 'standing the storm'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who 'holds' the believer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Hold on,' use 'Christ is the First and Last who holds you in the storm.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the hero who must match Polycarp.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the Receiver of Christ's faithfulness.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that Christ was the only one truly 'faithful unto death' on our behalf.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on the 'Power in the name of Jesus' as an active force that carries the believer, rather than a name they just 'know'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Second Death/Devil) is already sufficiently heavy.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The stakes are high enough; the issue is the Subject's lack of power to face them.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics/Endurance) is overshadowing the 'Fundamental Program' (Soteriology/God's Act).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Establish that because Christ is the First and Last (Soteriology), the believer is already safe, which then enables endurance (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically magnificent and Christologically lofty, but it risks crushing the 'shivering' hearer by making their endurance the hinge of eternity.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the repetition of 'Hold on' is inspiring; semiotically, it reveals a moralistic engine where the human is the primary actor.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis notes the command in Revelation; semiotics asks 'who is the engine of the action?' and finds the hearer is doing the heavy lifting.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that God is treated like a 'stable business firm' (Sender) rather than the one actually 'holding on' (Subject) for the believer.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'First and Last' imagery to provide a framework of stability, but the actual 'marching orders' are anthropocentric.
